thread.title: Bengals may not face Tyrod Taylor; Bills sign Josh Johnson
thread.title_full: Bengals may not face Tyrod Taylor; Bills sign Josh Johnson

title: Bengals may not face Tyrod Taylor; Bills sign Josh Johnson
text:
Bengals may not face Tyrod Taylor; Bills sign Josh Johnson 
Updated: Tue, Oct 13 2015, 01:40 PM 
CINCINNATI (WKRC) -- There are reports on Tuesday that Buffalo Bills starting quarterback Tyrod Taylor is injured and may not play in this Sunday's game against the Bengals. 
The Bills signed former Bengals backup quarterback Josh Johnson (pictured here during this year's training camp). 
Johnson was recently with the Indianapolis Colts as Andrew Luck was out due to a shoulder injury. 
If Taylor can't play against the Bengals then former first-round pick E.J. Manual would make the start. Manual hasn't thrown a pass this season. He was 2-2 as a starter last season and 4-6 as a starter in 2013. 
Follow us on Twitter @Local12 and LIKE us on Facebook for updates!
